Business Development Executive Job at RusselSmith




        
    

        
        RusselSmith is an ISO 9001:2008 certified asset integrity management services company incorporated to serve the needs of the global oil and gas exploration and production industry, using rope access technology as our principal medium of access. At RusselSmith, we pride ourselves in our innate ability to provide superior quality solutions at competitive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Business Development Executive will focus exclusively on converting identified opportunities into closed deals, ensuring revenue generation and contributing to the company’s sales targets.
	This role requires a results-driven professional skilled at client engagement, negotiation, and closing contracts.
	The candidate will work closely with the Business Development team to achieve strategic sales objectives.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of direct sales experience, preferably within the oil and gas or related industries.
	Demonstrated success in closing sales and meeting revenue targets.
	Strong sales acumen and closing skills.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels.
	Confidence in negotiating and effective persuasion.
	Proficiency in using CRM software and Microsoft Office tools.
	Knowledge of Nigeria and Africa's oil and gas sector is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@russelsmithgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "Endless Pharmaceutical Companies Limited&nbsp;is an indigenous pharmaceutical company,that specializes in sales, marketing and distribution of pharmaceutical products/drugs such as OTC, Multivitamins as well as other products that relates to Healthcare and Health services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours: Mon -Saturday (8.00 am - 5pm)

Position Summary


	The Human Resources (HR) Officer is responsible for supporting the organization&rsquo;s human capital management, ensuring compliance with HR policies, labor laws, and fostering a positive workplace culture.
	The role involves recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, payroll support, and general HR administration.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Staffing:


	Assist in workforce planning and recruitment activities.
	Prepare job descriptions, post vacancies, screen resumes, and coordinate interviews.
	Facilitate onboarding and orientation of new employees.


Employee Relations:


	Serve as a point of contact for employee queries and concerns.
	Promote open communication and handle conflict resolution where necessary.
	Support initiatives that build employee engagement and retention.


HR Administration:


	Maintain accurate employee records (contracts, leave, performance data, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, organizational policies, and best HR practices.
	Assist in preparing HR reports and metrics for management.


Performance Management:


	Support the performance appraisal process and provide guidance to managers.
	Monitor probationary periods and contract renewals.


Training &amp; Development:


	Identify training needs and assist in organizing learning and development programs.
	Support career growth and succession planning initiatives.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of HR experience (depending on role level).
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD) is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and HR software (HRIS).


Salary
N180,000 - N200,000 per month.

Human Resources Officer Job at Endless Pharmaceutical Companies Limited




        
    

        
        Endless Pharmaceutical Companies Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company,that specializes in sales, marketing and distribution of pharmaceutical products/drugs such as OTC, Multivitamins as well as other products that relates to Healthcare and Health services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer
Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours: Mon -Saturday (8.00 am - 5pm)

Position Summary
     

            
    




	The Human Resources (HR) Officer is responsible for supporting the organization’s human capital management, ensuring compliance with HR policies, labor laws, and fostering a positive workplace culture.
	The role involves recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, payroll support, and general HR administration.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Staffing:


	Assist in workforce planning and recruitment activities.
	Prepare job descriptions, post vacancies, screen resumes, and coordinate interviews.
	Facilitate onboarding and orientation of new employees.


Employee Relations:


	Serve as a point of contact for employee queries and concerns.
	Promote open communication and handle conflict resolution where necessary.
	Support initiatives that build employee engagement and retention.


HR Administration:


	Maintain accurate employee records (contracts, leave, performance data, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, organizational policies, and best HR practices.
	Assist in preparing HR reports and metrics for management.


Performance Management:


	Support the performance appraisal process and provide guidance to managers.
	Monitor probationary periods and contract renewals.


Training & Development:


	Identify training needs and assist in organizing learning and development programs.
	Support career growth and succession planning initiatives.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	2–4 years of HR experience (depending on role level).
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD) is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and HR software (HRIS).


Salary
N180,000 - N200,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: endlesspharm@gmail.com  using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
